intro: Corysanthes hispida, commonly known as the rough corysanthes, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or red and are borne in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Corysanthes hispida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
